Well, I arrived home yesterday around 6-ish, but I was too tired to post all about my nifty trip around a nice 4 state area, so now that I've rested up, here goes...

The trip started out Monday morning at around 5 AM.  After getting only 2 hours of sleep, I awoke, took a shower, and was made to drive.  I was also informed that I would be stopping in New Castle, PA, to pick up my nephew Eric, whom I had never met.  He had been adopted out to his father's aunt and uncle, but wanted to see his big brother graduate from high school.  Since he was on the way, our first stop was there to pick him up.  We instantly hit it off, talking about music and cartoons.  It was a nice experience for me, knowing that even after 15 years of not knowing me, he could still treat me with respect and family kinship.

Next stop, around 2pm on monday, we reached Toledo, Ohio.  I had driven this whole way, and was getting just a tad tired.  Besides, I had to acheive my objective for the trip! Play DDR in a new state!  After about 6 times, turning the map and the car around to get going the right direction on the street, we found NickleWorld, home of a rather shoddily-maintained Solo2000 mix.  The interesting thing about NickleWorld was that you pay about 2 dollars to get in, and then everything else runs on nickles....  It was pretty cool, actually.  I played 4 games of DDR for a dollar's worth of nickles.  Add the entry fee and I played 4 games for 3 dollars.  Not bad ^_^  I have to say that I am now NOT a fan of the Solo mixes.  The six-panel setup was awkward for me to grasp.  I think I'll just stick with my trusty left-down-up-right setup for the arrows.

And on to Pontiac, Michigan.  Mom drove the last 1.5 hours from Toledo there.  I drove the 7.5 hours that constituted the rest of the trip...  Anyways, we checked into the Wellesly hotel, which was very nice and homey, with a kitchenette and everything.  Very clean.  After taking the bags to the room, we went to my sister's house for a nice hug-ey reunion.  I got to see my neice Ashley, whom I hadn't seen since she was 10.  She's now 16.  We all decided to go out for a nice dinner, to the Rainforest Cafe at their huge Mills style mall, called Great Lakes Crossing.  What a crazy place.  Animatronic elephants, leopards, butterflies, and birds adorned the rainforest decorated walls.  Once every 10-15 minutes, the ceiling, painted to resemble the night sky, would flash and their sound system would go nuts, emulating a storm.  The waitstaff seemed like they had a good time ^_^.  Afterwards, we went right across the hall to Gameworks, where I played DDR in my second state for the day! The pad was in excellent condition, and I got to pass a song I hadn't ever done before.  I love Extreme.

The next day, Tuesday, was Dondi's graduation.  Earlier in the morning, mom, granny, and I all went over to my sister's again, and visited with my brother-in-law, and the graduate, himself.  Dondi has grown up so much.  He's become a very nice young man, and I was amazed again by how much respect I receive from my nieces and nephews, even though I'm so close to their age.  Between the visiting and the graduation ceremony, I snuk over to Gameworks and played some more DDR and GuitarFreaks, my favorite Bemani game EVER...  Was very fun...  Anyways, the graduation was interesting.  I've never seen so many names on a roster with an apostrophe in them...  L'Quan, D'Quifah, etc...  Afterwards, I partied with my sister and brother-in-law.  Got a little toasty, but I figured I deserved it after all the driving I did the day before.  

The next day, I regretted drinking, because I had to get up early and drive...  We took my nephew back to his adopted parents house, then went to visit an old friend in Beaver Falls, PA.  Pami and I have known each other since we were 10/11 years old.  We've always kept in touch, and this seemed like a great time to hang out.  I got to eat at the Hot Dog Shoppe, home of the best hot dogs and chili-cheese fries EVER...  Oh, how I had missed them...  Then after some visiting and playing around, my old friend Heather made an appearance.  I've known her almost as long as Pami, so it was really neat to be able to visit two long distance friends in one day.  Afterwards, had dinner at Quaker Steak and Lube.  Hottest hot wings I've ever tried...  They left my mouth numb.  Then...  Yeah, you guessed it...  Off to the mall to play some DDR.  ^_^

The next morning, we woke up leisurely, and got all packed and headed home.  Mom drove the whole way...  Making up a bit for all the driving I had done.  All in all, I'd say the trip was pretty fun...  

Today, I got my car emissions tested, picked up my perscription at the pharmacy, and had family night with my folks.  Saw "The Italian Job"....  Really nifty theif movie, if you ask me...  Dinner at Hunan Treasure afterwards was great.  I had yummy curry that no one stole from me because I'm the only adventurous diner in my family.  I always feel more comfortable eating with chopsticks ^_^

Tomorrow is my dog's 11th birthday.  I have no clue what to do for him.  I guess I'll just try and spend some extra time with him, and maybe give him an extra dog biscuit or something.  ^_^ I love my puppy.  

Well, now that I've made up for all the lost days in my journal, it's time to get going.  I was just talking with my friend Ross, and was somehow inspired to watch Labyrinth ^_^

Blessed Be!

Well, today was infinitely more productive than yesterday.  I packed for my trip to Michigan to see my nephew graduate.  I located the DDR machines I will be playing on in Ohio and Michigan to add those to my list of states I have played DDR in.  I got an IM from my great grand big brother, who has always helped me out whenever I get confuzzled about something in my life.  He really helped me see things clearer.  And it was the one thing I hadn't thought to do.  Think about what exactly it is that I want, not the possibilities and their probable outcomes.  Well, duh! Why wasn't I thinking of that all along?!  Anyways, afterwards, had hot wings for dinner...  Mom made them just a bit too hot, and I ended up with a headache >.<  Then.....  AAAAAGH!...  I cleaned out my car...  It wasn't AS bad as I thought it would be.  But it was still horrifically messy, nonetheless.  A couple trash bags, a roll of paper towels, and a quarter of a spray bottle of Armor All later, my car is in top form ^_^  All ready for my dad to drive it around while we're away.  I just hope he doesn't look in the secret compartment in the back and find the edible massage creme and bottle of lube........   At least I had the sense to throw away the condoms...  But the massage creme and lube were expensive! I'm not wasting a total of 20 dollars for only using them once, dammit!  AAAAnyways....  Got done with all the chore type stuff and chatted for a while, now I'm writing in my journal ^_^ yay!  Hopefully writing on a daily basis will help me get back my creative spark so I can start writing again.  I'll write while I'm away and post those entries when I get back...  Well, I'd better get to bed so that I can get some sleep for driving when I wake up in 2 hours >.<

Blessed Be, y'all!!!

So I'm bored...  And it's 2:00 AM...  And I really can't think of anything to do. Lately, everytime I've tried to draw or write anything, nothing comes out the way I want it to.  I feel like my creative impulse has been sucked out of me...  I can't get motivated about anything.  I haven't practiced trombone in over 2 months...  And I'm supposed to be going to school in August under a scholarship to play?!  Oh boy, am I fucked...  I've been trying to get a job for almost 3 weeks now, and not one of the places I've applied to have called me back.  

*SIGH*

It's times like these that make me wanna go buy a pack of cigarettes just so I can smoke ONE.  I think living with my parents after having a taste of living on my own is what's got me so down.  They really helped me out of a tough spot by having me come home for a semester, but I'm honestly ready to get the fuck out of here.  Mom constantly nagging, Granny constantly nagging and irritating the shit out of mom, so that mom takes out all her agressions on me...  Dad...  irritating the shit out of mom, so that mom takes out all her agressions on me...  The only one I'll be REALLY sad to leave is Donny.  I hope I get to where I can support myself pretty quickly, so he can spend at least a year or two with me before he checks out.  I'm a little frightened though.  He's been showing his age more and more lately.  My poor puppy...  *sniffles*

Maybe this is all just normal letdown.  The semster ended.  American Idol ended.  I'm left without the two things I devoted the most thought and energy to during everyday life...  I know it's horrible, and I'm the most anti-reality tv person you could ever meet, but I freely admit it:  I WATCHED EVERY EPISODE OF AMERICAN IDOL!  At first, it was just because that was what was on the tv, and since my parents have supreme tv rights, I couldn't change it.  Then...  I saw Clay Aiken...  And from there, I had to watch, because he is just...  Well, he's AWESOME...  *swoons*...  And it's BULLSHIT that he didn't win...  But I'm not bitter ^_^;;;

I think tomorrow, I'm gonna go get my hair cut.  It's been growing for a while, and it's almost down past my ears.  I can't stand it.  Every day I look in the mirror and think, "This haircut looks so dumb...  It needs to be short, the way it was..."  Mom insists that it is a wonderful haircut and makes me look more feminine.  *sigh*...  And she bought me a t-shirt cut for girls...  and...  I feel so damn insecure wearing that!  Gimme back my baggy RENT t-shirt!  Let me wear my baggy painter's jeans...  And dammit, as soon as I get a new job, I'm getting my eyebrow re-pierced!  I miss my eyebrow ring...  

Well, I think I've ranted enough.  Goddes, help me to think happier thoughts the next time I post...

Blessed Be, yo....  O_o;

"Mom," Kori called as the three Saiyans walked through the front door.  "Mom, are you home?"

"Yes," came a muffled reply from the kitchen.  "I figured you'd be home soon.  Lunch is almost ready, so come set the table, honey."

"Okay!"  Kori made the "shhh" motion to Kakkarot to keep quiet.  He winked back at her in acknowledgement.  They had both agreed on the way there that they wanted to surprise her mother with his appearance.  Rolling his eyes, Vegeta strolled past them into the kitchen to take his seat at the table.  Kori peeked around the corner to see that her mother was tending the stove, her back turned towards them.  Motioning to her newfound brother, they both walked silently into the kitchen, Kakkarot standing inconspicuously right behind Sharon.  Kori held back a chuckle as she set the table, making sure to have an extra setting for the tall Saiyan.  

After a few moments, Sharon turned slightly, not seeing Kakkarrot behind her, but noticing the table and the extra place setting.  "Honey, I think you put too many plates out.  Or is someone else coming for lunch," she questioned warily.

"That would be me," Kakkarrot spoke from behind her.  "I hope I'm not intruding."

Sharon, at first shocked by the voice behind her, turned slowly to see who it was.  She was met with a view of a rather expansive chestplate of Saiyan armor.  Her eyes traveled upwards slowly to take in the face belonging to the chest...  And her knees nearly gave out.  Eyes wide, she spoke shakily, "You...  You look...  Just like him..."

"Him," Kakkarrot blinked questioningly.  "My father?"

Sharon nodded dumbly.  Tears were already leaking from her eyes freely.  Vegeta turned away, and Kori fought to keep her own tears at bay.  Sniffling slightly, sharon's mouth turned upwards into a smile.  "You're Kakkarrot."

He nodded, grinning.  The older woman had barely moved to embrace him before she was swept up into his arms.  Kakkarrot held her tightly, yet gently, his face buried against her shoulder.  "I never knew...  my mother," came the muffled words from the tall Saiyan.  "Would it be acceptable...  for me to-"

"Of course it would, dear," she stopped him, already knowing what he was asking her.  She kissed his forehead gently, hugging him as best she could while she was dangling in his embrace.  After a few lingering moments, he placed her back down again, helping her regain her footing.  Although his face appeared dry, Kakkarrot's eyes were rather misty-looking.  Vegeta cleared his throat, ending a rather awkward pause that had ensued once Sharon was back on her feet.  "I'd...  I'd better finish lunch before it burns," she said, wiping her face on her shirtsleeve.

Lunch passed by quickly, Kakkarrot, Kori, and Sharon all sharing stories and remeniscing.  It almost seemed like they were a family.  However, Vegeta said virtually nothing during the meal, not seeming particularly angry, just like he was pondering something very significant.  

The remainder of the day, like their lunchtime, passed in a blur.  Vegeta had kicked the training up a notch, and was pleased to see Kori rise to the challenge.  They all entered the small home for dinner wearing an assortment of bruises and abraisions, but looking genuinely fulfilled.  After dinner, Kakkarrot settled down on the couch and quickly fell asleep, grateful to be able to stretch out a little after his journey on the ship.  Kori, realizing that tonight was a full moon, quickly retreated to her room and shut the curtains.  Finding herself unable to sleep, she leaned back against the wall, pulling out a book and deciding to read until her eyes felt heavy.

Once Sharon had turned in for the night, Vegeta walked quietly to Kori's room.  Nudging the door open, he spoke quietly so as not to wake anyone.  "Do you know what happens at the full moon?"

Startled by the sudden intrusion, Kori dropped her book.  She recovered quickly.  "Not specifically.  I promised my mother never to look at it.  She said horrible things would happen if I did."

"Not so horrible as you might think, girl."  Vegeta was silent for a moment, leaning against her doorframe.  He had changed into his Saiyan armor, which was slightly cracked, with a few tears in the spandex-like material underneath.  Kori turned away to hide the blush in her cheeks, her tail flicking about nervously behind her.  "Come with me," he extended his hand to her.  "I think it is time you learned what that tail is for."

Blushing more feircely, Kori stood, and followed him without question when he turned and headed for the front door.  She was, of course, afraid, but she trusted him.  He was a Saiyan, so he would know about what was going to happen, right?  At any rate, she at least felt safe around him.  

When they reached the door, he stopped, lowering his voice to a whisper.  "You must keep your eyes on the ground until I tell you otherwise.  Do not, I repeat, Do not look into the sky at any time.  We will travel by ground, and I will lead you, so all you need do is keep your eyes on the ground.  Do you understand?"

"I understand," Kori replied in a hoarse whisper.  Standing straight, she nodded resolutely.

"Good."  He grasped her wrist, pulling her ouside into the darkness.  She could feel the light of the moon on her.  The air seemed to vibrate with it, making her flesh break out in goosebumps.  It seemed as if the moon was calling to her to look up at it.   

//Just look at the ground, just keep looking at the ground,// She repeated to herself as he began to pull her along quickly.  They traveled for what seemed like a half an hour, but in reality, it had only been about ten minutes.  

A barren field stretched out before them, eerily illuminated in the moonlight.  Coming to a halt, Vegeta let go of her wrist, walking around behind her and grasping her shoulders gently.  "Now...  Look up at the moon."

Her shoulders began to shake as she scrunched her eyes shut.  //Should I really be doing this?  What's going to happen?!//  "I...  I'm..."  //Scared out of my wits,// is what she wanted to say.

"Look," he said, his voice more commanding now.  "Bury your fear now and look.  I will be here.  Nothing will harm you."  Though nearly growled out, the words were slightly comforting.

Taking a huge breath, and swallowing dryly, Kori forced her eyes open.  Slowly, she tipped her head back and locked her eyes on the full moon.

It was beautiful.  She'd only seen it in pictures and movies before, but that simply couldn't compare to the majesty of seeing that glowing orb hovering overhead.  Her reverie was short-lived, however, as her heart began to beat quickly, thundering hard against her ribcage.  A dull ache began at her tail and spread through her entire body, her breathing reduced to harsh pants.  

"Wha...  What's happening...  to me?!"  Spinning around, she saw Vegeta.  Or what used to be Vegeta.  His face was slowly transforming into something beastly, fangs sprouting from his open mouth, which was slowly becoming a blunted snout.  Fur began growing rapidly wherever she could see skin, and his flame-like hair converted to the dark brown color of the rest of the fur.  He stared back at her with bright red eyes.  Crying out in horror, she lifted her hands to her own face, feeling the same changes happening to herself.  "What the hell is happening," she yelled at him in panic.  Her voice seemed like it had changed, and suddenly the dull pain in her body amplified a hundred times as she began to grow rapidly, her clothes shredding off her as she became much to large to fit into them.

"A transformation," Vegeta said, his voice changing now, too, as he began to grow.  It looked as if he was some kind of giant ape.  The armor he was wearing seemed to be able to stretch to accomodate the size of this new form.  He kept speaking, but for some reason Kori's brain had gone foggy.  

As he waited for a reply, Vegeta got the feeling that something was drastically amiss.  Kori was crouched ferally, small snarls and growls the only sounds being emitted from her.  "Can you hear me," he questioned.  She just peered back at him warily.  Moving closer, he reached out to grab her wrist, and was met by a wild attack.  Clawing and roaring angrily at him, she freed herself of his grasp, retreating about 50 yards away from him.  //She can't control her Oozaru form...  It must be her human side that makes it hard for her to realize herself while transformed...//  

Cautiously, he approached her.  Hands extended in a non-threatening gesture, he attempted to connect.  "Easy...  Don't be afraid, I won't hurt you..."  Her eyes scanned him warily.  "Try to recognize me...  Vegeta," he hoped his name might spark some recognition.  For a moment, her eyes seemed to soften, perhaps remembering who he was.  But that moment was short-lived.  Vegeta was caught off-guard by an energy blast from her mouth as she roared out her fury.

Pulling himself to his feet, Vegeta applied pressure to a rather nasty cut on his arm.  //Dammit, I don't think I'll be able to put up with this until morning...//  Emmiting a growl of his own, he flung himself at her, and after a long scuffle, managed to get the upper hand.  Before she could get away, he quickly ended the fight with a well-placed blow to the neck.  Kori slumped against the ground, slowly returning to her normal form.

Vegeta quickly noticed a rather embarassing problem...  She was naked.  If he could have blushed, he would have.  //Damn, where's a giant ape going to find clothes for a naked girl with a tail at this time of night?!//  There had to be a solution...

//Of course!//  It was right there in front of him.  His gloves had stretched to fit his hands...  //Hopefully they'll stay the same size when removed...//  He had never tried it though.  Carefully, he peeled the glove from his left hand.  It began shrinking slowly, but not at an extremely rapid rate.  Quickly, he picked up the young half-Saiyan and placed her into it up to her shoulders.  It stopped shrinking when it became snug around her.  He let out the closest thing to a sigh of relief that an Oozaru was capable of.  Slowly, and as quietly as possible for a gigantic monkey, he began to carry her home.

As the moon sank below the horizon, Vegeta slowly assumed his normal form.  He had waited a short way from Kori's house, not wanting to risk waking anyone by shaking the earth with his footsteps.  //Hopefully, the girl's mother will still be in bed...//  He did not want another encounter with the vengeful side of that woman...

Making as little noise as possible, he carried Kori into the small house, looking around warily to make sure they were unseen.  Kakkarrot was snoring loudly on the couch, with the dog curled up on the floor next to him.  There was no sign of Sharon.  Vegeta snuk to the back of the house, easing through Kori's half-open door, and laying her down in her bed, pulling the covers over her so that the gigantic glove was out of sight.  He almost chuckled at the sight of her stuck in his over-sized glove.  

A door creaked down the hall, and Vegeta darted quickly back into his own room, making sure to move fast enough not to be seen by human eyes.  Two urges overcame him, as was normal after spending the night as an Oozaru.  The first was to sleep.  the second was to eat...  After a short moment of consideration, he decided that the second could wait, and not long after removing his armor and laying down upon his bed, he fell into a deep, dreamless sleep.

The trip home was much too short for Kori to completely collect her thoughts in preparation for talking to her mother, and as they landed, Vegeta noted a distinct air of purpose about her.  She turned to him, face rather stony, and said, "I...  I need to talk to my mother.  Alone.  Would you mind occupying yourself elsewhere while I discuss with her what I need to discuss..." she trailed off, then blinked and quickly added, "Prince Vegeta," as she bowed her head respectfully.

The prince nodded, his respect for her jumping up another notch.  //This battle is hers alone to fight.//  "Done."  He reached out, nearly placing his hand on her shoulder in what would have been a reassuring gesture.  But he quickly realized what he was doing, and pulled his hand back, taking to the air without another word.  

Kori sighed softly, watching his form retreat over the forest in the waning sunlight.  She turned, walking almost sullenly into the house, patting her dog lightly on the head as she walked by him.  "Mom," she called out unsteadily.  After recieving no answer, she walked further into the house, towards the kitchen.  "Mom," she said a little louder, seeing her mother in the kitchen, cooking dinner.  

Sharon looked up, a rather harsh look on her face.  "WHERE have you been?!  I have been WORRIED SICK about you," she scolded.  "You didn't leave a note!  I came home, and both you AND that Vegeta fellow were gone.  And with you in your condition, I should think the LAST thing you'd do is go out somewhere."  She took a few deep calming breaths, then looked Kori straight in the eye.  "So...  Are you going to explain to me what's going on," she said in an expectant and authoritative tone.

Kori attempted to push the red that always occurred after being berated by her mother back from her cheeks.  She took a few breaths, trying to prepare herself for what she had to say.  "Mom...  I..."  She swollowed.  "Last night, we got into dad's lab.  He...  Left a message for any Saiyan that might find the lab.  It contained a star-chart to find his whereabouts, and the blueprints for a ship that could make it there.  We, Vegeta and I, were at Melissa's.  She and her dad work for NASA.  They're going to build the ship.  And in about 10 or so days I'm..."  She paused, steeling herself.  "I'm leaving with Vegeta.  And Melissa.  We're going to find my father.  I want to find him.  And to help Vegeta save our people."  Her voice had begun to shake slightly, but nevertheless she remained unshakable.  

Kori's mother stood there with an utterly blank stare on her face.  She closed her eyes for a moment, tears starting to leak silently from behind her eyelids.  When she opened her eyes, they were full of pain and sadness.  And also, understanding.  After a few long moments, she finally nodded.  "I knew... Some day," she sniffed back more tears, "some day you would leave, and go off looking for your heritage.  I just didn't think it would be so soon..."  She wiped at her eyes, only to have the tears replaced by fresh ones.  "You can go...  But I...  I can't go with you.  Even though I want to, I can't.  I have the bakery to look after, and a home...  And even though I don't want to admit it, I would be a burden to you.  Melissa is young, and even though she's a human, she'll be able to handle the dangers this trip will throw at her.  But I'm getting old, Kori.  I can't endanger you by coming along and slowing you down."  She wiped at her eyes, as tears were now flowing freely from them.

Kori didn't know when the tears had started streaming down her own face, but somewhere along the line they had started dripping off her chin onto her shirt, soaking the collar.  She sniffled slightly.  "Mom...  I'm sorry I have to leave you..."  

Sharon shook her head, trying to clear it.  She laughed sadly.  "It's okay.  Besides, why are we getting all sad right now anyways?  We've still got ten more days, right?"  She wiped at her tears again, drying her eyes.  "And it's not like after your adventures you can't come home again."  She smiled softly.  "You can always come home," she said reassuringly.

Kori smiled back, drying her own eyes.  She nodded.  "Thank you."  Kori blinked, looking at the stove.  "Um, mom, your pot's about to boil over..."

Sharon blinked, a startled expression coming to her face as both she and Kori began working to prevent having dinner become an absolute mess...

Vegeta flew back to the house after about an hour, entering through the window of the room they had given him.  It was then that he noticed a repetitive beeping noise in the corner.  //SHIT!  My scouter!//  He cursed himself for not wearing the device or at least keeping it with him.  He picked it up, attaching it hurriedly over his ear and eye and pressing the button on the earpiece to accept an incoming hail.  "Who is it," he asked gruffly.

"Prince Vegeta," a familiar voice exclaimed urgently.  "Where have you been?!  Why haven't you answered our hail?!"

"Save your reprimands for later, Kakkarrot, I'll fill you in once you tell me why you're hailing me," the prince replied hastily.

"Sire, it's Vegeta-sei," Kakkarrot's voice sounded desparagingly grim.  "Freiza has begun mobilizing his forces.  Our inside sources tell us that within a standard month's time, he will lead a full-out assault, with the sole purpose of dominating and overthrowing the royal government.  The King already has such a weak hold over the people that upon hearing this, a good part of the general populace rose against him...  He is being held captive in the Palace dungeon, meanwhile, Brolli, Nappa, and I have organized a sort of board of executives to run affairs on Vegeta-sei.  We attempted to hail you, but after your continuous absence from your scouter, I took the liberty of manning your cruiser with a good crew and coming after you.  The people of Vegeta-sei eagerly await your return, my...  My King."

Vegeta paused, taking this all in and spinning it around in his head for a few moments.  He was king...  Yet he was silently angry for not being able to become king by defeating his father in battle as per his birthright.  

"Sire?"  Kakkarrot brought him back to reality...

"Kakkarrot, I think you would be interested to know that you have a sister," Vegeta said in an amused tone.

Kakkarrot sputtered.  "A what?!"

"Yes, it seems that the rumors were true.  Bardock came here for refuge.  And he settled down with an earthling woman, producing a daughter, half human and half Saiyan.  Shortly after her birth, Freiza's men caught on to where he was, and he fled, leaving behind a lab that no one had opened since his absence until yesterday.  Inside, we found that he had fled to the planet Namek.  He left us blueprints to a ship that will be capable of getting us there.  Construction is already underway on that ship, and we should be leaving to find him in about 6 standard days."

Kakkarrot chuckled.  "You move fast, sire.  We will arrive on Earth in just under 2 standard days, and, if you wish, my crew and I will accompany you to Namek, or, return to Vegeta-sei."

"Kakkarrot, I believe I may need you on this mission, my friend.  I trust that Nappa and Brolli will be able to handle running affairs on Vegeta-sei until we find your father."  Vegeta knew he could probably do just fine without Kakkarrot, and that the other saiyan might be more useful to him if he returned to Vegeta-sei, but he knew that Kakkarrot wanted to see his father.  He chuckled inwardly, thinking that it would be like looking at a mirror image to see the two of them standing together.

Kakkarrot also knew that the prince...  the King, could fare well without him.  "Thank you, sire," he said in earnest.  "I will keep you updated, should we receive any news from our informants.  Kakkarrot out."

Vegeta pulled the scouter from his face, staring at it.  He was the King of Vegeta-sei...  Slowly, a smile spread to his lips.  As soon as it had come, it vanished, however, at the thought that he may very well have become King only to lead the Saiyan race to it's extinction.  //I will not let that happen,// he affirmed to himself.  "I will find a way..."

The lift doors barely had time to open before Kori bolted out, leading Vegeta to the kitchen.  She realized that she hadn't eaten in almost a full day, and with her wounds trying to heal, she was more famished than she could ever remember being in her life.  Her tail flicked out anxiously behind her at the prospect of a good meal.  As she and the Prince reached the kitchen, she quickly called for one of the serving droids and, after pressing a few of the buttons on its chest display hurriedly, it whizzed off to get their food.  She turned to Vegeta, saying, "It'll only be a few minutes, the droids are fairly quick about fixing the food..."

Vegeta simply nodded in response, crossing his arms over his chest and leaning against the nearby counter nonchalantly.  After a few moments 2 voices, one male and one female could be heard approaching, though neither of them were familiar to Vegeta's acute hearing.  Kori seemed slightly unnerved though and she quickly hid her tail beneath her shirt, turning to face the entryway of the kitchen.  She motioned for him to do the same, but he just snorted.  The Prince of the Saiyan race would NOT hide his tail as if it were something to be ashamed of.  He did, however, wrap it discreetly around his waist, having it look like a rather thick, furry belt.  As the voices drew nearer, he noticed the half-Saiyan taking calming breaths, and he wondered idly why she would be so nervous...

The pair that entered the room were deeply engrossed in conversation, though it must have been a pleasant one, because they were both smiling lightly.  The man was a good height, taller than Vegeta by about 3 or 4 inches, and he had a full head of neatly combed brown hair...  or was it deep purple?  He could see a definite resemblance between his and Melissa's faces, thus deducing that they were related, and most likely brother and sister.  The girl that was with him was thin, with a mass of blonde curls sprouting from her head that hung just to her chin.  She was also scantily clad, moreso than he had seen any of the other women on this planet so far.  It seemed that by wearing so little clothing she was trying to draw attention to her rather massive busom or to her curved posterior.  Or both.  Either way, Vegeta didn't care much for the garments...  or lack thereof...  

He didn't have long to observe the newcomers because the male looked up from his conversation, and upon seeing Kori in the corner, broke into a nervous smile.  "H-hey there, Kori," he grinned a little wider.  "What are you doing here? And who's your friend," he asked, gesturing to Vegeta as his female friend slipped off, most likely to the restroom.

"I was just...  visiting Melissa...  And this is Pr- er...  Vegeta.  Vegeta, this is Mark, Melissa's brother..."  She gave Vegeta an almost apologetic look for not introducing him properly.  

Mark stuck out his hand, plastering a huge grin across his face. "Nice to meet you."  Vegeta, sensing that something was not quite right about Mark, simply inclined his head towards him, leaving his hand hovering in midair.  The grin faded from Mark's face.  Mark turned to Kori.  "Hey, he's not your boyfriend is he," he asked softly.  Kori blushed, but before she could say anything, he misinterpreted the blush to mean "yes".  "He's not mad because I kissed you, is he," Mark winked at her.  Kori blushed an even brighter shade of red, and stood there sputtering, not able to get any words out.  Suddenly, Mark's eyes darkened as he looked over Kori's bruised face, noting the slash over her eye.  He pulled her to the side of the kitchen, whispering urgently, "He hasn't been beating on you, has he....?  Is that why you can't say anything?"

Vegeta, who of course had heard everything Mark said, was quickly starting to lose his patience with the way he was treating Kori.  First, the man had apparrently assumed that he and the half-Saiyan were involved romantically.  //Preposterous,// Vegeta snorted.  Now this idiot had the nerve to ask if he was using physical force to keep a woman silent about a relationship that they weren't even in!!!  This thought forced a soft growl from Vegeta's throat.

Kori, whose face was contorted in anger, had been readying a retort, when a low rumbling sound came from Vegeta's direction.  Kori and Mark simultaneously blinked, looking over at him.  Mark, slightly unnerved, coughed nervously and asked, "D-did...  you just...  growl?"

Vegeta smirked, eyes narrowing like an animal on the hunt.  "Yes," he stated simply.  "Your idiocy is exhausting."  Mark's eyes widened.  Vegeta took a step forward.  Mark took a hesitant step back.  "You assume much for how little information you actually have.  We sparred, that is how she obtained her injuries.  She willingly subjected herself to anything that happened to her."

Mark was starting to get a little ancy.  If Kori could beat him easily, and this is what happened to her after simply sparring with this "Vegeta", he didn't even want to think about what would happen if he antagonized the guy any further.  "E-easy man, I was just concerned about Kori..."

Vegeta took another step closer. "She does not require the concern of a weakling such as you," he spat.  "She is strong enough to handle her injuries."  Kori watched all this happen in a half daze.  On one hand she didn't want any harm to come to Mark, but on the other, she hoped that Vegeta could shut him the hell up.

Mark stepped back again, this time his back came into contact with the wall, and he realized he didn't have anywhere to go.  His face blanched as he stuttered nervously, "L-look, I d-don't want to fight about this..."

Vegeta stalked forward again.  "No, you don't," he affirmed, his smirk becoming more feral.  

Mark, who was actually starting to fear for his life, groped back behind himself, finding a rather imposing kitchen knife, and readying himself, should Vegeta attack him for some reason.  Kori saw Mark grab the knife and started to warn Vegeta, but he had caught the slight movement, seeing a glint of metal near Mark's side.  In a flash, the knife was not in Mark's hand, but Vegeta's, and Mark was being held forcibly up against the wall by his throat by something that wasn't one of Vegeta's hands.  He really couldn't wonder what it was at that moment though, because of the sheer fact that he was choking.

Kori, stunned, rushed up to Vegeta, but the look in his eyes made her wonder whether she should try to stop him or not...

Vegeta growled menacingly, whatever it was holding Mark's throat drawing tighter.  "What did you think you were going to do with this, boy," he held up the knife.  "You're pathetic!"

Kori couldn't stand it any longer.  "Vegeta, drop him," she yelled.  

"Why? He insulted my honor," he growled.  "For that he deserves to die."

Kori's eyes widened.  She had to think of a logical way to get him to drop Mark, and FAST...  "He's Dr. Griffey's son!  If you kill him, Dr. Griffey won't build the ship!"

Vegeta growled louder, knowing she was right.  He shot the red-faced, strangling Mark a look that could burn through steel, and unceremoniously dropped him on his rump.  Vegeta's tail, which had been holding him up by the neck, flicked out behind him in an expression of his pent up agression.  Vegeta threw the knife to the ground at his side.  "Here's your weapon, for all the good it will do you..."

Mark coughed, rubbing at his throat and panting for air.  Once he caught sight of Vegeta's tail, however, his face bleached white and, after blinking a few times, he quickly scrambled from the room, still half-ways on his hands and knees.  Vegeta snorted derisively at him as Kori wiped the sweat from her brow.  //That was close,// she thought.  She had to figure out a way to curb the violent Prince's temper somehow, before he killed someone for looking at him wrong...

Suddenly the curly-haired blonde Mark had walked in returned from the restroom.  Noting the look on both Kori and Vegeta's faces, she simply turned and walked out of the room, looking for Mark.  About 10 droids arrived after another minute, bearing a wide selection of foods, and the two hungry Saiyans dispensed formalities and started devouring the food, forgetting the tense situation that had happened only minutes before.

Melissa walked in, looking for them.  "Hey, Mark's acting funny, someone must've scared the shit out of...."  Melissa stopped as she observed the two stuffing food into their mouths, much in the manner of ravenous wolves.

Kori stopped long enough to shrug and say, through the food in her mouth, "Wasn't me..."

Vegeta let out the closest thing to a laugh she'd heard him produce in the short time she'd known him.  His tail swished proudly behind him, and she could swear he almost grinned...

Melissa chuckled.  "Good.  He needs to be set straight..."  She contemplated snagging a sandwich, but thought better of it, seeing as how she might get her hand bitten off...  "Anyways, I came up here to tell you that my dad and I can build the ship, but it's going to take about a 10 days, maybe a week if we don't sleep."  She waited for a reaction.

Vegeta wiped his mouth with the back of his hand.  He nodded to her in approval, for he had actually expected it to take much longer.  "Good.  As the Prince of the Saiyan race, I will, of course recompensate you and your father for your services.  Simply set a price and I will match it, to the best of my ability."

Melissa didn't even blink.  "Let me come with you.  That's all the payment I require."

Vegeta's eyes nearly came out of his head.  He sputtered loudly, nearly growling.  Letting a mere human accompany them would severely impede their mobility, speed, and ability to defend themselves in battle.  He silently berated himself for offering to pay any price within his ability, for he knew that this was well within that range.  After a long inner debate, he finally conceded.  "Fine," he said gruffly.  "You may come with us.  But you must see to it that you are able to handle yourself in the environment we are traveling to.  I will not let you become a burden to my mission."

Melissa nodded excitedly.  "Don't worry, I can take care of myself better than you think..."

Somehow Vegeta doubted that.  Kori grinned, nearly picking Melissa up in a hug.  "This is great," she said excitedly.  "I was kind of hoping to have some companionship..."

Melissa just winked as Kori let her out of the embrace.  "Yeah, I've always wanted to go out there on one of the ships dad and I have made.  It's kind of been my dream."  She grinned.  "Well, I better not waste any time, I'm gonna go get to work.  You guys can stay if you want," but Kori cut her off.

"I'd better get home and talk to mom about all this.  I don't know how happy she'll be that I'm leaving the planet in a little over a week," Kori said nervously.

"Right.  Well, I'll give you a call tonight and update you on our progress, okay?"

"Okay," she said, hugging her friend again.  "Bye!"

"Bye," said Melissa, walking back to the lift to go down to the lab.

Kori turned to Vegeta.  "We'd better go."  Vegeta nodded, heading for the door.  Luckily, they did not encounter Mark on the way.  Once they were outside, Vegeta moved to pick her up again.  Kori blushed deep red, backing up, "N-no, it's okay.  I...  Think I can fly on my own this time..."  Vegeta nodded, and almost smiled...  Almost.  Then they quickly took to the air, heading back to Kori's house.

***

As they landed on the front lawn of the Griffey residence, Kori stepped quickly out of Vegeta's arms and onto her own two feet, blushing slightly.  Though she wasn't sure whether she was blushing out of embarassment from having to be carried, or because of being in such close proximity to the Saiyan Prince.  The blush did not go unnoticed, and the prince smirked quietly to himself.  //Flustered, little halfling,// he wanted to ask.  He quickly shook his head to clear it.  He had better things to do that vy for the affections of a weak half-breed.  //A weak half-breed that could very well help save the entire Saiyan race from extinction,// he reminded himself.  //And who knows? With the correct training, she could hold her own with even the toughest of warriors.//  His thoughts were cut short as a shorter human girl ran out of the gigantic house towards Kori.

"Kori, you're here!  What took so lo-" she stopped short, seeing the bruises across Kori's face and arms, and the slash that marred her face.  "My god, what happened?!"

Kori quickly held her hands up in an "it's okay" gesture. She took a breath, trying to figure out how to phrase it...  "Um, well..."  She looked over to Vegeta.  "Ve- I mean, Prince Vegeta and I...  sparred..."

Melissa looked over Kori, then looked over Vegeta, then back to Kori.  "Jesus, if that's what he did to you sparring, I'd hate to think what would've happened if he actually fought you!"  She looked over Kori again, stepping closer.  "Are you...  okay?"

Kori chuckled, smiling.  "I'm fine.  Just a little bumped up.  Nothing I can't handle."

Vegeta smirked inwardly, approving.  //She wears her battle scars proudly.  As a Saiyan should.//  He grimaced.  //Since when did I become so preoccupied with her behaviors?!//  He berated himself as the girls went over the past days happenings quickly.  He examined the other girl as she and Kori talked.  She was short, not as much so as Kori's mother, but visibly shorter than Kori.  Her hair was long, and tied back from her face with a band.  As he looked harder at her dark brown hair, he began to realize that it was really a deep shade of...  purple?  //These earthlings have interesting hair colorings,// he mused.  Though she did not look very strong, she was actually rather pretty.  As the girls' conversation waned into unimportant matters, he cleared his throat, reminding Kori of the reason they were really there.

"Okay," Melissa started, "Let's go find dad.  He's probably tinkering in his lab..."  Melissa started leading them into the house, Kori following, and Vegeta bringing up the rear.

***

As they stepped off the lift in the basement of the mansion, Kori's eyes were greeted by what was probably the most comprehensive, technologically advanced, and...  messy... laboratory that she'd ever seen.  In fact, it was about the size of a small airplane hangar.  Computer screens lined the walls, little lights flickering and flashing everywhere, machines ticking, buzzing, and cranking away busily.  Designs cluttered the tables and desks, and most of the chairs around.  The technology was such that she'd never seen, even in some of her books.  Her long lost father's small lab paled in comparison.  She whistled low in awe and admiration.  "Geez, Lyssa, you and your dad sure have a lot of...  um...  stuff," she chuckled.  Melissa just laughed in agreement.

Vegeta, though he gazed scrutinizingly at the clutter, nodded approvingly.  If there was anywhere on this planet that could build the craft they needed to get to that backwater planet Bardock had fled to, this was the place.  Vegeta stiffened warily as a pile of junk in a nearby corner began to stir.

"C-could someone give me a hand," said the pile.

Vegeta blinked.  Kori stifled a chuckle.  Melissa just rolled her eyes.  "Dad, how did you get stuck in there?"

"That doesn't matter right now, honey.  The important thing is that I get out..."  The pile of junk shifted a bit, and the man grunted softly.

After Melissa and Kori shared a chuckle at Vegeta's utterly confused expression, the three of them moved quickly over to move pieces and parts of machinery off the pile.  Soon, a short, gray-haired, slightly balding man with thick silver framed glasses and a wiry moustache emerged.  He rubbed gingerly at his elbow, then sighed.  "Thanks, kids.  I really need to do something about this place.  It's getting where I can only find things when they fall on me."  He and the two girls laughed together.

Though Vegeta winced at the "kids" comment, he waited politely to be introduced, rather than scare the man off by demanding that he build his spaceship.  He didn't have to wait long, though, as Melissa quickly ceased her laughing and got down to business.  "Daddy, um, Kori's dad was an alien from another planet, and they need to find him.  This is the Prince of that planet, Prince Vegeta, and they need you to take a look at a ship design to see if you can build it so they can go find her father."

Kori's mouth hung open, staring at Melissa in shock at how casually she had said that all to her father.  //What the hell are you doing?!//  She tried to calm herself, hoping he'd take the information without freaking out or worse.

Vegeta didn't show any emotion but to blink.  Inwardly, he saluted the girl's straightforwardness, but questioned how well her father would take such a huge shock to his system.

Dr. Griffey blinked, and seemed to be mulling things over in his head for a few seconds.  Then he smiled.  "Well," he said, turning to Kori, "I always knew something was strange about you.  All that strength, and you supernatural speed...  And the tail..."  Kori blushed.  "I know you tried to hide it, but I'm not quite so addlebrained as you think.  So, this ship.  You need it solely to find your father?  Or does finding her father," he turned to Vegeta, "serve some higher purpose?"

Vegeta nodded honestly.  "Our race, the Saiyans, have slowly been enslaved by a tyrant, Freeza.  We fear war with him, but her father, Bardock, may have the key to turning the tide in our favor.  I mean to seek him out and ask for him to rejoin his people, to help us free ourselves from Freeza's rule."

"And why should I envolve Earth in your war?  What danger would I be putting the people of this planet in if I agree to help you?"

Vegeta thought for a moment.  "You would put Earth in more danger by making my stay longer than by facilitating my leave.  The longer I am here, the more chance Freeza has to come and find me."  He paused.  "And would you deny a race their freedom?  Would you deny her a father?"  He gestured to Kori, waiting for the older man to respond.

Kori's heart beat hard against her chest.  It was all she could do to keep her mouth shut as she silently pleaded with her eyes for him to help.  She wanted, more than anything, to meet her father.  To know what her people were like.  To belong...

Dr. Griffey, after a long moment, nodded tersely.  "You have me there.  Very well, I will build the ship."  He couldn't have said much else, because Kori hugged him tightly, lifting him slightly off the ground.  Vegeta shook his head disapprovingly.  He would have to break her of that habit before reaching Vegeta-sei.  He stopped.  Was he already thinking of taking her to Vegeta-sei with him?  

"Thank you, sir!  I promise, I'll help as much as I can.  As much as you'll let me..."  She set him down, letting him out of the hug.

Dr. Griffey readjusted his glasses, catching his breath and chuckling.  "Well, give me the design and let's see what we've got..."  Vegeta handed him the small disk/chip that held the design and they walked over to a computer to view it.  Melissa grabbed Kori's elbow and pulled her out of hearing range of the other two.

"Why didn't you tell me he was a total hottie," Melissa whispered excitedly.

Kori rolled her eyes, even though she blushed slightly.  "Is that all you think of?!"

"Oh come on, you can't possibly tell me that he's not hot..."

Kori sighed...  "Fine, yes, he is, but he's a Prince!  I'm just...  A half-breed.  I'm probably lower than pond-scum to him..."

"Oh Bullshit!  I've never seen anyone look at 'pond-scum' the way he looks at you."

Kori blushed bright red.  She hadn't really noticed him looking at her at all.  "I don't know Melissa.  I'm just glad he doesn't want to kill me.  Between you and me, I think if he wanted to, he could probably kill everyone on the planet.  It's kind of scary..."

Melissa shivered.  "Shh.  Don't talk like that."

"Melissa," Dr. Griffey shouted excitedly, "Come and look at this!"

The two girls hurried over to the screen where Dr. Griffey was displaying the ship design.  Most of it was greek to Kori, but Melissa understood it perfectly.  "Wow! That's the most advanced design I've ever seen!"

"It's the most advanced design I'VE ever seen," said Dr. Griffey.  "Which is really saying something.  I've never seen a drive system like this before.  I wonder if this is your father's own design, Kori..."

Kori stared at the two in awe and maybe even a little jealousy.  She wished she could share something like that with her own father.  A low, loud rumble from behind her jerked her from her reverie.  She turned to see Vegeta, who was trying to look inconspicuous, but just as she was about to turn back around, the rumble started again, and she pinpointed the location of the sound with a chuckle.  "Hungry," she asked him.  He simply nodded.  Her own stomach tugged at her consciousness as well.  "Hey Melissa, d'you mind if we go get some food from the kitchen?"

"Go ahead, we're stocked up," she said, chuckling.  "Dad and I are gonna go over this a bit more, I'll be up in a few minutes, okay?"

But Kori and Vegeta were already in the lift, getting ready to go up.  "Okay," Kori shouted back as the door shut.  Melissa chuckled as the lift ascended to the main floor.
